Topic.Title: TI at Analysts Day: company to de-emphasize mobile R&D and OMAP

Message.Msg: . "NVIDIA's Colorado-based team ABANDONED the work on [the original Project Denver] x86 instruction set architecture and pushed through with "reinventing" the Project Denver core..." . Jeepers Best, World-renowned semiconductor manufacturing expert Charlie Demerjian was 100% correct -- again. Charlie informed us OVER A YEAR AGO that "Project Denver" -- a desperate attempt by Jen to copycat a Genuine Intel x86 processor -- would Never see the light of day. "Never" said Charlie, presciently, Check it out for yourself, boys. Google for Charlie Demerjian's Masterpiece: What is Project Denver based on? . "SemiAccurate has it on very good authority that this [Project Denver] would not have succeeded, and based on what the sources showed us, the chip Never would have made it to market." -- Charlie Demerjian, Aug 5, 2011. . It is Absolutely Impossible to emulate the Intel x86 architectue without infringing on many of Intel's 5,000+ patents relating to the x86 processor. And since Jen failed -- and Failed Badly -- in his attempt to cross-license Intel's x86 patents, the end result of Jen's "Project Denver" folly was a massive waste of R&D cash. . "Texas Instrumentsâ€˜s (TXN) today held a meeting with analysts to discuss its plans to shift R&D investments...." Jen did the same thing -- he just skipped holding a meeting with the analysts discussing plans to "reinvent" the Project Denver fiasco. .

Message.Title: Semi conductor is a sad sector to be in
Message.Msg: Look at AMD, txn etc. Headwind too strong. Sigh. Pc makers Dell hpq all new low again.

Topic.Title: TI at Analysts Day: company to de-emphasize mobile R&D and OMAP

Message.Msg: Why is that so hard to believe? Qualcomm does it with its Krait cores, and with a roughly 2 year dev cycle. Apple's apparently done it with the A6. Tegra bashers insist this is partly because the off-the-shelf ARM cores (A9s) are weighed down by kruft unnecessary for the use case(s). NVDA has longer than that invested in the custom 64 bit cores extending the ARM instruction set, rumored to to still be at least a year away from hitting the market, and has its eye set on a range of low to high performance applications of their SoCs which will be NVDA GPUs at the center of custom designed 64 bit cores.

Topic.Title: TI at Analysts Day: company to de-emphasize mobile R&D and OMAP

Message.Msg: I read SemiAccurate too, and I think even Charlie Demerjian says Denver (he says it's still the T50 on their roadmaps) is lstill coming -- it just won't emulate x86, which is what he was saying will never ships. He seems pretty confident, even in his most recent articles about the subject, that "Project Denver" is still coming, it's just changed slightly from what it was years ago -- and no longer aims to emulate x86 along with supporting ARM, MIPS, etc. instruction sets. The main aim of the project has been to get high performance SoCs that put NVDA GPUs at the center of custom CPUs. Some will be designed for low power consumption (Tegra, Denver) others will be targeted for high power, high consumption (supposedly project Boulder).

Topic.Title: At&t, verizon : is cloud gaming just around the corner?

Message.Msg: From Nvidia Homepage... Nvidia Geforce Grid. (has a video or two as well from conferences) located under drop-down menu "Products"--- "Cloud Computing"--- "Gaming". Here is a summary of what I've heard so far... Capable of playing a high end game off your computer on your cellphone or other underpowered device. All data is on server end. (Alows for near instant play) (A lot like OnLive) When coming from cloud, the technology stays up to date, thanks to constant expansion and updating of the cloud. No need to send the game data. Just what you see. (should get around some pirating issues)

Months later, they seem to finally break free of the mind control and start realizing... hey Apple is up over 50% and this POS hasn't crawled passed 15 yet.. I thought it was on it's way to 20.. but it's going lower again.. why isn't this POS making me any kind of money? Message.Title: Any updates on Icera modems shipping?
Message.Msg: I read the articles about the AT&T certification of the Icera 410 earlier this year -- but has anyone seen any recent news on Icera LTE modems actually shipping in any smartphones or tablets? Anyone know how they will be fabbed?

Topic.Title: Any updates on Icera modems shipping?

Message.Msg: Icera LTE modems are only 50mbps capable and are a kluge compared to 100mbps capable modems from QCOM and Renesas Mobile. So it is like they are in 11 b/g when others are shipping 11ac in WiFi. So One X probably uses a QCOM modem. Also modems require some high volume platforms to ship with as they need to work in demanding networks world wide. Only Infineon/Intel, ST-Ericsson, QCOM and Renesas Mobile which used to be in Nokia have that track record in 2G and 3G and only QCOM in LTE. Icera will struggle in winning designs in large accounts.

Topic.Title: Any updates on Icera modems shipping?

Message.Msg: So Icera's technology bought by Nvidia was useless?

Topic.Title: Holy short interest Batman!!!

Message.Msg: . "Nvidia Corp. short interest rose by a stupendous 56.6%, to 14.9 million shares or about 2.5% of the companyâ€™s float." . So Best? How do they know? The Bears, that is. EVERY YEAR around this time The Bears gather. At Nvidia Creek. To catch struggling fish trying so desperately to swim against the current. Upstream they swim, driven to try to lay some eggs, and then die. And The Bears, they gather. Man 'o man have they gathered at Nvidia Creek this year. Take a look boys. Google this and behold: HD: Grizzly Bears Catching Salmon - Nature's Great Events: The Great Salmon Run . nvidia has been struggling, right? It sure has. nvidia hasn't won a decent order in months and months. The high-volume Amazon Kindle 2 went with Texas Instrument's superior parts. Instead of nvidia. It looks like nvidia has lost all three (3) gaming consoles to AMD. Apple's A6 self-designed processor just blew the doors off the Tegra 3. By a factor of three times (3x) faster. The General Manager of nvidia's money-losing Tegra Division just quit. Leaving the Tegra unit -- which is on track to lose $750 million this year -- leaderless. (-$750,000,000.00) of losses, boys. Just this year alone. Intel's new Xeon Pro co-processors are FAR more energy efficient than the aging Tesla. The cloud fad is going absolutely nowhere -- like the 3D fad before it. Folks aren't interested in buying anything except Apple products. And Apple's market share of the tablet market is hitting new highs. Leaving fewer iScraps for nvidia and the other hapless android people. And Jen really laid an egg with that 7-year old Project Denver fiasco. . EVERYBODY knows nvidia is a dying company. Especially The Bears. Yes -- The Bears -- they know. Which is why they have gathered in unusually large numbers at Nvidia Creek. It's Sushi Time for The Bears, boys. Caviar too. . "Nvidia Corp. short interest rose by a stupendous 56.6%, to 14.9 million shares or about 2.5% of the companyâ€™s float." .
